reviews.text: Room and breakfast were standard, but no internet access available. I was told that only four rooms have wireless connection, with wired LAN in the remaining rooms. However, none of the LAN connections worked which is a big drawback for business travellers. Also, some of the keys do not work with the room locks.

reviews.text: Have stayed here many times. Staff very friendly. Nicely maintained property. Ok breakfast, the usual stuff, you can make waffles etc.. Mac Donalds across the road and small shopping mall with Winn Dixie grocery store, Big Lots, Baels Outlet, chinese restaurant, pizza place, Wendy's and a barber. reviews.text: i booked this hotel for two nights on a thurs and fri. oct.12th and 13th 2006, i selected this location as it was very handy to the airport and the cruise port from which we were departing on the 14th. the hotel was easy to find and check in went well.i was given two electronic room keys, upon getting to the room neither key would open the door,back to the desk, was given new keys,to make a long story short,every time we left the room the key would not work when you returned.. on the second day after having to return to the desk a total of 11 times over the two days i was no longer happy about this situation and i told the clerk that i was getting tired of this, and what were they doing to solve the problem,at this point he started shouting at me that he was a professional and he doesnt need to listen to me complain,at this point a second clerk came out but did not say anything.i was given two new keys one of which did not work.i can only say that as a retired supervisor of a large dept. of a large customer service co.if i or any employee of mine were to talk to a client or customer in this manner he would be subject to disiciplenary action or dismissal. aside from an employee with one of the worst attitudes i ever encountered the hotel was clean ,quiet, the pool was well kept, and the cont.breakfest was good.

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Limited breakfast fare. Only complaint was about wireless Internet connection not available in rooms.

We came in from a cruise and had to spend a night in Fort Lauderdale. The next day it was off to the airport for our flight back to Chicago. The appealing thing about this hotel was its proximity to both Port Everglades and to the Fort Lauderdale airport (FLL). A free shuttle van picked us up at the CruisePort after about an hours wait and three phone calls. Not a real problem. A 10 minute ride and you arrive. Our room was very clean with a great king-sized bed. A refrigerator, microwave, and VCR come with the room. The pool was clean and enjoyable, but pool furniture had seen better days. The complementary breakfast was very adequate along with the free USA today. Another plus was the free wide band internet connection to catch up on the weeks worth of e-mail that was waiting. Shuttle ride to the airport took about seven minutes and curbside checkin was a breeze. I liked the place and would go back!!
reviews.title: Great for a one-nighter!!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in March 2006 for 6 nights. On the surface, it seems like a reasonable place if you can set aside the cheap plastic feel of everything. The thing that really destroys this place is the people. The hotel is run with unveiled contempt for its guests. The airport shuttle drivers shoot glares at you after they take 45 minutes to pick you up from the airport and then add insult by directly requesting a tip while you're sill in the van. The desk clerks are mostly blunt, unfriendly, unhelpful men (although there are one or two exceptions to this rule) and the two men that seem to own the place are particularly unpleasant grumpy individuals. The contempt continues in the guestrooms where you are threatened by the large signs hanging in the bathroom (if you take one of our sandpaper-like towels, we will charge $10 to your credit card). Your obvious thieving tendencies are thankfully controlled, however, by a cord that attaches the iron to the ironing board, although it does make ironing your clothes technically impossible. I could continue on about the overall cheapness, tackiness, and grumpiness, but I think it comes down to this: if you desperately need a place to stay for a night and don't mind being an unwelcome guest then this place might be okay, but if you want a hotel that will be comfortable for a few nights you should definitely look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Decidedly Mediocre

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. Collection from airport worked well-made courtesy call from baggage area and was collected in 10 minutes. Return to Airport next morning to collect rental car again efficient but if you are doing this get driver to drop you at Terminal 1 departures and then you can walk straight through to car hire building. Front desk was courteous; room was clean and adequate; and complimentary breakfast, while not extensive, was a bonus. All in all excellent stopover hotel.
reviews.title: Very Convenient

aka: Best Western Plus Fort Lauderdale Airport / Cruise Port Hotel
description: Two-Story Hotel, conveniently located in the heart Fort Lauderdale, minutes from Interstate 95, Convention Center and Airport. Ideally located in the heart of the Ft. Lauderdale Air and Cruise Port, the Best Western Fort Lauderdale Airport/Cruise Port provides comfortable accommodations for business and leisure travelers to the area. Each spacious, well-appointed room is fully equipped with complimentary high-speed Internet access, cable satellite television with HBO, microwave, refrigerator, coffee/tea maker and iron/ironing board.
